# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    # Lowercase the column name
    col = lowercase(col)

    # Strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = strip(col)

    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, r"[ -]", "_")

    return col
end
```

Note that the `lowercase` function is used to convert the column name to lowercase. The `strip` function is used to remove any leading or trailing whitespaces from the column name. Finally, the `replace` function is used to replace any spaces and hyphens with underscores in the cleaned column name.
